author: David Gauthier-Villars
title: Turkish Media Sale to Narrow Scope for Political Opposition
text:
An industrial tycoon close to Turkey’s President Recep Tayyip Erdogan is in talks to buy a collection of Turkish newspapers and television channels, a transaction that risks further impeding opposition voices ahead of next year’s elections.
The assets include the flagship Hurriyet daily newspaper—long a bastion of Turkey’s secularists opposed to Mr. Erdogan’s platform rooted in conservative Islam—and CNN Turk, a joint venture with New York-based Time Warner Inc. 
...
